text: Evin Prison is Iran's most notorious prison. It is in the foothills of the Alborz Mountains above Tehran. Some of Iranâ€™s most respected activists and lawyers are serving time in this prison. The prison started in 1971 during the rule of Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi as a place for political prisoners. At the time, there was space for 320 prisoners. Since the 1979 revolution, the prison has 15,000 prisoners. The prison has a reputation for brutality and torture. It is believed that many people died in this prison from torture. == References == Category:Prisons in Asia Category:Human rights abuses in Asia Category:1971 establishments in Asia Category:1970s establishments in Iran
